content.description: A proton is held in place at the origin. Points <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> are located on the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis at locations <math alttext="x sub A" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>x</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="x sub B" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>x</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></math>, where <math alttext="x sub B is greater than x sub A, which is greater than 0" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>x</mi> <mtext>B</mtext> </msub> <mo>></mo> <msub> <mi>x</mi> <mtext>A</mtext> </msub> <mo>></mo> <mn>0</mn> </math>.
content.question: Which integral could be used to determine the electric potential difference <math alttext="delta V sub A B" overflow="scroll"> <mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi> <msub> <mi>V</mi> <mtext>AB</mtext> </msub> </math> from Point <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> to Point <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="delta V sub A B equals, negative k e times the integral from x sub A through x sub B, of, the fraction d x over x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>AB</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>e</mi><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></msubsup><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><mi>x</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta V sub A B equals, k e times the integral from x sub A through x sub B, of, the fraction d x over x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>AB</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>e</mi><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></msubsup><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><mi>x</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta V sub A B equals, negative k e times the integral from x sub A through x sub B, of, the fraction d x over x squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>AB</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>e</mi><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></msubsup><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta V sub A B equals, k e times the integral from x sub A through x sub B, of, the fraction d x over x squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>AB</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>e</mi><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></msubsup><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="delta V sub A B equals, negative k e times the integral from x sub A through x sub B, of, the fraction d x over x squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>AB</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>e</mi><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></msubsup><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
